title: Limetree Bay Refining Gets Approval for $62 Million Bankruptcy Sale to New Buyers
sub_head: The successful joint bidders are set to takeover the U.S. Virgin Islands-based refinery, which shut down and filed for bankruptcy this year
body:
Limetree Bay Refining LLC received approval from a bankruptcy judge on Tuesday to sell its refining operations for $62 million to a pair of Caribbean oil companies that plan to restart the U.S. Virgin Islands-based refinery despite two bankruptcies in under 10 years and a long history of pollution.
Kingston, Jamaica-based West Indies Petroleum Ltd. and U.S. Virgin Islands-based Port Hamilton Refining and Transportation LLLP received approval as joint buyers of the refinery from Judge David Jones of the U.S. Bankruptcy Court...
